decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to control the game through manipulation of the opponent's deck and resources. This is achieved through cards like Terminus, Counterbalance, and Sensei's Divining Top, which allow for efficient removal and counterplay. The deck also aims to generate advantage with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage, while also being able to generate threats with Entreat the Angels. Overall, the deck aims to maintain control of the game and outvalue the opponent through careful decision-making and resource management.

The main concept of the Grixis Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures while disrupting their game plan with countermagic and hand disruption spells. The deck utilizes powerful one-drop creatures like Delver of Secrets and Deathrite Shaman to apply early pressure, supported by cards like Young Pyromancer and True-Name Nemesis for additional threats. With a mix of burn spells, card draw, and disruptive elements like Wasteland and Cabal Therapy, the deck aims to maintain tempo and control the pace of the game to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Seething Song and Lotus Petal in order to play powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn through effects like Through the Breach and Sneak Attack. The deck also utilizes cards like Blood Moon and Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's mana base and game plan. The inclusion of cards like Inferno Titan and Batterskull provide additional threats and flexibility in different matchups. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, such as Griselbrand, Elesh Norn, and Grave Titan, using cards like Entomb and Careful Study. The deck then aims to cheat these creatures into play by using Reanimate, Exhume, and Show and Tell. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is designed to support this strategy with fetch lands and dual lands for color fixing.

This deck utilizes the infect mechanic to quickly defeat opponents by dealing 10 poison counters. By using creatures with infect like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf, along with pump spells like Berserk and Invigorate, the deck can deal lethal damage in just a few turns. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Daze and Force of Will to protect its creatures and ensure the combo goes off smoothly. Additionally, card draw spells like Brainstorm and Gitaxian Probe help to dig for key pieces of the combo and maintain card advantage.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and card advantage through the use of creatures like Heritage Druid and Wirewood Symbiote, as well as extra mana from Gaea's Cradle. By chaining together multiple creatures and spells, the player aims to combo off with cards like Natural Order and Craterhoof Behemoth to overwhelm the opponent with a massive board state and finish the game in a single explosive turn. The deck's synergy and efficiency allow for consistent and powerful combo plays that can quickly close out games.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells, manipulating the top of the library with Sensei's Divining Top and Counterbalance, and clearing the board with Terminus. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and Predict. In addition, it can generate tokens with Entreat the Angels for a strong finish. The mana base is built to support spells from multiple colors, ensuring versatility in dealing with various threats. The key strategy is to outlast opponents through resource management and strategic decision-making.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping into powerful Eldrazi creatures using Cloudpost lands and mana acceleration artifacts like Candelabra of Tawnos. It also utilizes the combo of Show and Tell to cheat out big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Primeval Titan. The deck includes utility lands like Karakas and Eye of Ugin to support the main strategy of quickly dropping massive threats onto the board. The deck also includes control elements like Pithing Needle and Repeal to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent through resource denial with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, while also utilizing hatebears like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth to slow down the opponent's game plan. Aether Vial helps cheat creatures into play quickly, while Stoneforge Mystic searches for powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Batterskull. The deck also includes utility creatures like Flickerwisp and Recruiter of the Guard to provide flexibility and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to ramp up mana quickly using powerful lands such as Ancient Tomb and Eye of Ugin, while deploying aggressive Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer to apply pressure on the opponent. Chalice of the Void and cards like Dismember provide disruption, while utility lands like Karakas and Mishra's Factory offer additional versatility. By leveraging the high-impact creatures and mana acceleration, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and disrupt their game plan to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly flood the board with powerful Eldrazi creatures like Eldrazi Mimic, Matter Reshaper, and Reality Smasher, supported by cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and utilize disruptive elements like Wasteland and All Is Dust to control the game. Additionally, the inclusion of utility lands like Karakas and Eye of Ugin provides flexibility and additional advantages in certain matchups. The deck focuses on aggression and disruption to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Food Chain combo by using cards like Ponder, Manipulate Fate, and Brainstorm to find the necessary pieces. Force of Will and Abrupt Decay are included for protection and disruption. Once Food Chain is in play, the deck aims to generate infinite mana to cast Misthollow Griffin or Eternal Scourge repeatedly, generating a powerful board presence. Leovold, Emissary of Trest provides additional value and disruption, while Deathrite Shaman and Walking Ballista help control the board and provide win conditions.

The main concept of the deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent while maintaining a steady flow of threats on the board. By using cards like Wasteland, Stifle, and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to protect its own threats like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and Young Pyromancer. The deck also utilizes efficient card draw and selection spells like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Gitaxian Probe to ensure consistency and enable powerful plays. Overall, the deck seeks to control the board and pressure the opponent to secure a victory.

This UWx Control deck focuses on maintaining control of the game by utilizing various counterspells, removal spells, and card manipulation to disrupt the opponent's strategy. With powerful cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Terminus, the deck aims to control the board state and outvalue the opponent. The deck also includes a Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top combo to further disrupt the opponent's spells. Entreat the Angels provides a win condition by creating a swarm of angel tokens, while Snapcaster Mage offers flexibility and recursion. Overall, this deck aims to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by using a combination of counterspells, card draw, and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to control the top of your library, you can effectively counter your opponent's spells while deploying threats like Monastery Mentor and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to finish the game. The deck relies on a strong mana base with fetch lands and dual lands to consistently cast its spells and control the game.

The deck focuses on quickly putting powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. It includes a mix of cantrips and counterspells to dig for combo pieces and protect against disruption. By resolving a Show and Tell or Sneak Attack, the deck can put a game-winning threat into play ahead of schedule, overwhelming opponents with massive creatures that can close out the game in just a couple of turns. The key is to get the combo pieces in place and execute the combo as efficiently as possible.
